entries.meaning: A person who grabs or grasps for something.
examples: [He] once called diggers greedy gold grabblers.

entries.meaning: (Southeastern US) One who harvests food (such as tubers or peanuts) by digging it up with the hands.
examples: a goober-grabbler (dated slang term for a person from the U.S. state of Georgia, literally, one who harvests peanuts by hand)

entries.meaning: (Southeastern US) A person who catches fish by feeling with the hand.
examples: […]  Darl had to grabble for her so I knew he could catch her because he is the best grabbler even with the mules in the way  […]

entries.meaning: (Southeastern US, Barbados) An implement used for grabbling (digging up) tubers.
examples: […]  then Bobtail he got his bull-tongue plow and his grabbler and pretty soon there was his potatoes.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) An implement used to extract bodies from the water.
examples: […]  four Boats, and several Men in them, with Ropes and Grablers, searched the Thames a great part of Sunday, using all Opportunities to find the dead Body;
